paragraphs.content: Unto thee lift I up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Unto thee lift I up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the heavens.

paragraphs.content: Behold, as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress; so our eyes wait upon the LORD our God, until that he have mercy upon us.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress; so our eyes wait upon the Lord our God, until that he have mercy upon us.

paragraphs.content: Have mercy upon us, O LORD, have mercy upon us: for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Have mercy upon us, O Lord, have mercy upon us: for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.

paragraphs.content: Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scorning of those that are at ease, and with the contempt of the proud.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scorning of those that are at ease, and with the contempt of the proud.
